intro: Tapeinostemon capitatus, commonly known as the Cape Town daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its showy yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green ray florets, creating a distinctive appearance. Tapeinostemon capitatus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
